alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Floyd; Grayson; Patrick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 26 at 11:53AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of North Carolina, including the following counties, Surry and Wilkes and southwest Virginia, including the following counties, Carroll, Floyd, Grayson and Patrick. * WHEN...Through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of moderate to occasionally heavy rain will fall today through Wednesday morning. Additional rainfall totals are expected to range from 1 to locally 2 inches. The greatest potential for any flooding will be near the crest of the Blue Ridge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
